articles.headline: Head of Luxury Goods Maker Kering Buys Majority Stake in Talent Agency CAA
articles.snippet: The deal for Creative Artists Agency by François-Henri Pinault’s family office reflects the growing convergence of celebrities and fashion.
articles.abstract: The deal for Creative Artists Agency by François-Henri Pinault’s family office reflects the growing convergence of celebrities and fashion.
articles.lead_paragraph: In a deal that shows the ever-growing convergence of fashion and fame, François-Henri Pinault, the French billionaire and chief executive of the luxury goods company Kering, said on Thursday that his family office had bought a majority stake in one of Hollywood’s biggest talent agencies, Creative Artists Agency.
articles.byline: By Lauren Hirsch and Vanessa Friedman

articles.headline: D.E.I. Statements Stir Debate on College Campuses
articles.snippet: Yoel Inbar, a psychology professor, thought he might be teaching at U.C.L.A., but his reservations about diversity statements got him in trouble.
articles.abstract: Yoel Inbar, a psychology professor, thought he might be teaching at U.C.L.A., but his reservations about diversity statements got him in trouble.
articles.lead_paragraph: Yoel Inbar, a noted psychology professor at the University of Toronto, figured he might be teaching this fall at U.C.L.A.

articles.headline: ‘Dumb Money’ Lampoons Wall Street Titans With a Knowing Eye
articles.snippet: The film tells the story about the stock market frenzy over the video game retailer GameStop. It was financed and produced by the son of a Wall Street superpower.
articles.abstract: The film tells the story about the stock market frenzy over the video game retailer GameStop. It was financed and produced by the son of a Wall Street superpower.
articles.lead_paragraph: “Dumb Money” is the kind of midbudget, formula-busting, thinking-person’s movie that isn’t supposed to get made anymore, much less receive a wide, studio-backed release in theaters.

articles.headline: After Prigozhin’s Death, a High-Stakes Scramble for His Empire
articles.snippet: A shadowy fight is playing out on three continents for control of Yevgeny Prigozhin’s sprawling interests as head of the Wagner mercenary group. The biggest prize: his lucrative operations in Africa.
articles.abstract: A shadowy fight is playing out on three continents for control of Yevgeny Prigozhin’s sprawling interests as head of the Wagner mercenary group. The biggest prize: his lucrative operations in Africa.
articles.lead_paragraph: African leaders allied with Russia had grown used to dealing with Yevgeny V. Prigozhin, the swaggering, profane mercenary leader who traveled the continent by private jet, offering to prop up shaky regimes with guns and propaganda in return for gold and diamonds.
articles.byline: By Anton Troianovski, Declan Walsh, Eric Schmitt, Vivian Yee and Julian E. Barnes

articles.headline: I.R.S. Deploys Artificial Intelligence to Catch Tax Evasion
articles.snippet: The tax agency is opening examinations into large hedge funds, private equity groups, real estate investors and law firms.
articles.abstract: The tax agency is opening examinations into large hedge funds, private equity groups, real estate investors and law firms.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Internal Revenue Service has started using artificial intelligence to investigate tax evasion at multibillion-dollar partnerships as it looks for ways to better police hedge funds, private equity groups, real estate investors and large law firms.

articles.headline: A Sudden Bond Binge on Wall St. Reflects Rising Optimism
articles.snippet: The rush by companies to borrow comes as fears of a potential recession recede and executives expect interest rates to remain high.
articles.abstract: The rush by companies to borrow comes as fears of a potential recession recede and executives expect interest rates to remain high.
articles.lead_paragraph: Companies have rushed to borrow tens of billions of dollars this week, a sign that optimism about the outlook for the economy is beginning to take hold.

articles.headline: Vietnam and U.S. Forge Deeper Ties as Worries Rise About China
articles.snippet: President Biden is expected to celebrate a new upgrade in relations with Vietnam this weekend, despite concerns about the country’s authoritarian crackdown and repression.
articles.abstract: President Biden is expected to celebrate a new upgrade in relations with Vietnam this weekend, despite concerns about the country’s authoritarian crackdown and repression.
articles.lead_paragraph: When President Biden arrives in Vietnam on Sunday, he is set to celebrate a new phase in the Washington-Hanoi relationship that would bring two historical foes closer than they’ve ever been, drawn together by China’s mounting ambitions.

articles.headline: G.O.P. Gets the Democratic Border Crisis It Wanted
articles.snippet: The strain of migrants in New York, Chicago, Los Angeles and other cities has taxed resources, divided Democrats and put pressure on President Biden to act.
articles.abstract: The strain of migrants in New York, Chicago, Los Angeles and other cities has taxed resources, divided Democrats and put pressure on President Biden to act.
articles.lead_paragraph: When Gov. Greg Abbott of Texas began sending migrants and asylum seekers from the southwestern frontier to New York, Washington and Chicago, he vowed to bring the border to the Democratic cities he said were naïvely dismissing its costs.
articles.byline: By Jonathan Weisman and Nicholas Fandos

articles.headline: Georgia Panel Recommended Charging Dozens, Including Lindsey Graham, in Trump Case
articles.snippet: A special grand jury made the recommendation last year after hearing from dozens of witnesses on whether Donald J. Trump and his allies interfered in the 2020 election.
articles.abstract: A special grand jury made the recommendation last year after hearing from dozens of witnesses on whether Donald J. Trump and his allies interfered in the 2020 election.
articles.lead_paragraph: A special grand jury that investigated election interference allegations in Georgia last year recommended indicting more than twice as many Trump allies as prosecutors eventually sought to charge, including Senator Lindsey Graham of South Carolina, the former senators David Perdue and Kelly Loeffler of Georgia, and Michael Flynn, a former national security adviser.
articles.byline: By Richard Fausset and Danny Hakim

articles.headline: China Is Full of Risks. So Why Can’t Corporate America Leave?
articles.snippet: Doing business in China, once seen as a can’t-miss opportunity, poses a troubling quandary: Reasons to stay can be as compelling as the reasons to retreat.
articles.abstract: Doing business in China, once seen as a can’t-miss opportunity, poses a troubling quandary: Reasons to stay can be as compelling as the reasons to retreat.
articles.lead_paragraph: For decades, America’s corporate chieftains saw China as a money spinner. They gushed about its hundreds of millions of consumers, called it “one of the biggest opportunities” and made predictions that this would be “China’s century.”
